_header: Hail fairest that ever God found
Note: For a similar version by John Audelay see 2909.
_description: ‘A salutacion of oure Lady’ — seven l2-line stanzas (ababababcdccd)

CULFf238.First Lines:
Heyle fareest þat euyr god fondeHeyle modyr & mayden
                    free…
CULFf238.Last Lines:
…That we in heuene maie haue a seteAnd dwelle with the blessyd
                    floure Amen
CULFf238.Facsimiles:
McSparran,  Frances,  and  Pamela R. Robinson.  
             “Introduction.” 
             Cambridge University Library MS Ff.2.38.
         London: Scolar Press, 1979.
CULFf238.Editions:
Person,  Henry Axel. 
             Cambridge Middle English Lyrics.
         Seattle: University of Washington Press, 1953; rev. ed. 1962: 11-13.

CamMagPep1584.First Lines:
Heile fairist þat euer was foundeHeile modir and maydon
                    fre…
CamMagPep1584.Last Lines:
…That we in heuyn may haue a seteAnd Duell with þe
                    blissid floure Amen
CamMagPep1584.Attributed Title:
Here begynnyth þe salutacioun of owre lady (rubric heading, bottom, f.
                        102r); salutacion of our lady (RT)
